body:
### Problem

When I switch from one iTerm2 terminal window/tab into another terminal window/tab with an open neovim 0.11 instance, `j` (or arrow down) jumps to the bottom of the buffer while `k` (or arrow up) jumps all the way to the top instead of moving just one line. It worked fine in previous versions.

### Steps to reproduce

Run `nvim --clean <somefile>`
Move to the somewhere in the file
Switch to another iTerm2 window or tab
Switch back to the neovim instance.
Press `j` or `k` and observe the cursor jumping to the bottom or top respectively

### Expected behavior

Should move only one line

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1741730670

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No

### Operating system/version

macOS 15.3.2

### Terminal name/version

iTerm2 3.5.11

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

homebrew

comment_data.body:
after staring `nvim --clean`, try clearing the default TermResponse handler:

    :au! nvim.tty

does that fix it?

> after staring `nvim --clean`, try clearing the default TermResponse handler:
> 
> ```
> :au! nvim.tty
> ```
> 
> does that fix it?

Nope, problem persists.

Try this:

    nvim --clean --cmd 'lua require("vim.termcap").query = function() end'

that should totally disable the terminal querying.
Doesn't work either. BTW: I can see that some processing is happening to the terminal tab when switching away.

I'm encountering the same issue, and neither suggestion helps me either.  However, I've noticed some more symptoms, which I hope will help you track this down.

I can only replicate this when iTerm2 is full-screened.  When switching back to iTerm2, the count `2844` appears in the status line, which is then applied to the following command.
Can you check a previous release of iTerm2, say from 1 year ago?

> I can only replicate this when iTerm2 is full-screened. When switching back to iTerm2, the count `2844` appears in the status line, which is then applied to the following command.

I'm not using it in full screen mode but I've also seen a seemingly random count appear some times.

> Can you check a previous release of iTerm2, say from 1 year ago?

Yep 👍 

3.5.0 is good, no problems there, same with 3.5.5.  3.5.6 onwards (I tested each of those in between just to be sure) shows the bug happening.

I also noticed that coming out of full-screen changes the count from `2844` to `1980`.  I'm not sure if those numbers are useful to know but given they're replicable for me I thought I'd mention them anyway.
The reason it started since Nvim 0.11 is likely because we do more "terminal queries". OTOH, I wonder what changed in iterm 3.5.6+
This problem may be caused by the same reason as #33079
> This doesn’t reproduce on the latest iterm nightly, so I’m assuming this was a iterm2 bug that is now fixed.

I can confirm that I can't reproduce on iTerm2 nightly. Still might be interesting to know what changed between nvim 0.10 and 0.11 that triggered this and maybe come up with a workaround? Not sure when iTerm2 is going to see the next release and this will likely bother many people once they realize nvim 0.11 is out...

Neovim is actively querying more terminal capabilites in 0.11 to enable more features. If iTerm doesn't handle this specification correctly, then issues are to be expected (and need to be fixed on their side -- which it sounds like it has already happened).

> Neovim is actively querying more terminal capabilites in 0.11 to enable more features. If iTerm doesn't handle this specification correctly, then issues are to be expected (and need to be fixed on their side -- which it sounds like it has already happened).

Sure. However, even if it is iTerms fault, what you're suggesting is letting the nvim 0.11 users on the Mac hang out to dry: iTerm2 is insanely popular so you can expect that many (probably most) of the Mac users are going to face this and potentially other issues until iTerm2 can cut a new release **and** users have upgraded. There's a good chance this project will see a number of duplicate reports, too, causing unnecessary additional load for the nvim project. If there's a workaround or even just a way to detect the problem and put out a warning, that would make a ton of sense to me.

BTW: This has some other "interesting effects", too. If you try to exit nvim after a switch, it will go on a looong CPU revving detour chasing its own tail... I've attached a trace for your viewing pleasure.

[nvim_iterm2_exit_tail_chase.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19547043/nvim_iterm2_exit_tail_chase.txt)

there are also issues on the iterm window resize which drives nvim crazy. There is report on that in iterm2 (https://gitlab.com/gnachman/iterm2/-/issues/12212) but it makes no sense since there were no updates of iterm since January and the problem appeared with nvim release only. Beta version of iterm seems to solve some mentioned issues, but nvim starts weird flickering. Would be great to see maybe some collaboration between nvim devs who can debug what is wrong here so that iterm can be fixed (if it is fault)

> There is report on that in iterm2 (https://gitlab.com/gnachman/iterm2/-/issues/12212) but it makes no sense since there were no updates of iterm since January and the problem appeared with nvim release only

It does make sense, because as mentioned multiple times above, Nvim 0.11 introduced new terminal queries.

Another point of reference... Even with the last iTerm2 nightly, if Settings->Profiles->Terminal->Emulation features:->"Disable session-initiated window resizing" is checked, every time you switch to an ITerm2 tab with an active neovim, iTerm2 fire's an alert "A program has tried to resize the window. Allow it?" I gave up hitting "Allow once" about 20 times ;)
iTerm2 3.5.12 is out, fixing at least the original problem, so I'm happy considering my problem addressed and this issue closed.

I just installed nvim for the first time and I'm seeing this. 
NVIM v0.11.1
iTerm2 3.5.13

milestone.description: We don't plan to work on this, but will accept high quality contributions from someone who will own the feature and follow up on bug reports.
milestone.title: needs-owner

title: iterm2 3.5.6+ with neovim 0.11, on FocusGained,  j/k jump to top/bottom of buffer
